Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 11:33PM dianekearns wrote: I was most recently treated with Navilbene, the pain was going away, but then I had a cat scan which showed that even though the pain was almost gone, the growth had actually gotten bigger. I did have another hot spot on my chest wall at the same time that the Navilbene worked on and got rid of.  No other chemo drugs were offered, I went right to radiation.  Do you know of other chemo drug names that perhaps I could ask my Dr about?  Thank you for your time...
Posts.Title: I need to ask someone if they have the same diagnosis as I do dianekearns Marta

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2008 02:41PM dianekearns wrote: jdash can you tell me what chemo drugs worked for you so I can mention them by name?  Thanks -
Posts.Title: I need to ask someone if they have the same diagnosis as I do dianekearns Marta

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2008 02:37PM dianekearns wrote: Chelee -  Never too many questions, information is important.  I never saw a path report so I can't answer what was on it.  My Dr knows me very well, so she knows what information is good for me to have and what I don't need to know...I understand that. My last tumor marker, last week, showed a decline to 37.5 from 44.5, which is a borderline normal so I guess the radiation is working, but now that is done.  I go for an MRI in 4 weeks to see whats left and then decide from there what to do next.  I am definitely going to ask my Dr about another chemo to try before surgery. Although she says once its removed I'll be in remission again so thats very tempting, if it works out that way.  I was on herceptin for a year when I had my second recurrence so they're not sure if that kept me from recurring sooner or didn't help to prevent a recurrence.  I went off the herceptin then to give my heart a rest because I was starting the chemo. Mimi - keep your chin up, I know exactly how you feel, every day is an emotional challenge and I never know what to expect.  One day I feel strong and another day I feel at a loss for control. Talk to your Dr. about your options and get straight answers.  Make a list of questions and write down what they tell you or bring a friend to listen, I never remember specifics. Have you gone for a second opinion?  This could give you more information you need. You are not alone here, write back and let me know how you are doing
Posts.Title: I need to ask someone if they have the same diagnosis as I do dianekearns Marta

Posts.Content: dianekearns wrote: I was diagnosedDec 2000 and went thru chemo and radiation.  I had a recurrence in May 2006, went thru chemo and now it has returned in my lymph nodes in my superclavical (neck). Had chemo, didn't work, am almost finished radiation, only shrunk 25%.  Now my Dr wants to operate to remove, which she originally told me would only spread it around and didn't recommend at that time. I am very discouraged and don't know what to do.  I would hate to have my neck cut open if it isn't going to work anyway, but since I have 2 kids want to do what I should.  Has anybody been thru this and can offer their experience ?  I really need some insight, I just want to get a grasp on how much further I'm supposed to go...Thanks...
